title: Appalling Practice
body: Unable to get appointments, if you phone at 8am often engaged or after endless messages you are 10th in the queue. Visited at 8.45 to be told all appointments booked for the day and to call or visit at 8 the next day. Receptionist unhelpful, two people there but only one speaks to patients. Doctors do not seem to see people, however when eventually you may get to see a nurse they are very helpful

title: Great hospital
body: Nurses very friendly and efficient made me feel at ease at the radiology department very well impressed felt safe as the covid rules were strictly followed

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Disgusting
body: The reception staff need too retrain on how too speak too people! There social skills are  next too none! So rude and very unprofessional

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: Great appointment with nurse
body: I was so grateful to the nurse I saw at this practice yesterday. She was really kind and also professional, and she seemed very experienced and knowledgeable about her job. The appointment was for a smear test, which I don't like having, but she made it as good as it could have been. I really felt like I was in good, safe hands. Thank you very much.

title: Good practice...always able to get through
body: I always get through on the phone...appointments given to me, often on the same day....staff professional and helpful....I am very happy with the practice as a whole

title: reasonable practice
body: I usually find the staff reasonable. They have referred me to a weight management course, when I requested. And having a flu jab was painless, the staff was excellent.

title: Good experience
body: Very quick and easy …. Covid secure …..good service ….. hopefully will get back to normal service and seeing Dr face to face soon

title: Flu Jab
body: Received a text offering  flu vaccination and vaccinated next day. Practice clearly giving high priority to prevention.

title: Outstanding
body: The help, care and efficiency of this practice is second to none. I attending for my covid vaccine and found the set up very organised and helpful. Thank you.

title: Good doctors.
body: Flu jab , was well organised, there was no waiting around, staff were efficient and injection was painless. Thankyou.

title: Great  Practice
body: The staff at the reception are friendly and respectful. The nurses are good at their job and the Doctors are always supportive and try diagnosis on any ailment you complained about. I will recommend it over and over again. If there are a 1000 stars, I will give that to them and I will do that.  May God bless and keep them.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: Patient Safety/Waiting Time/poor staff attitudes
body:
Poor quality care and treatment in your urgent care centre. It is extremely appalling. People left sitting in wheelchairs for hours without an ounce of consideration for their dignity. One elderly lady had to ask another patient in the waiting area for support to use the toilet before your  staff intervened. 

The waiting list is poorly managed. ill people were walking out after hours of not being attended to. The attitudes of staff was appalling.The name badges are so small I couldn’t see their name. A staff member became rude when people where beginning to be frustrated by your waiting times, she began to portray herself as a victim of the frustrations people were expressing. She has no etiquette unfortunately. She kept pronouncing people’s names incorrectly especially difficult African surnames. I requested that she pronounced my name correctly and she was irritable in her response not even taking a moment to reflect that it is not ok not to pronounce people’s names in that fashion.

It was sad to see people walking out with their children without being seen. How has it come to this?  CQC needs to station it’s self in your urgent Care Centre to see what is happening. I understand there is a nurse and doctor shortage. If you are unable to operate safely consider closing down rather than give people hope that care is available. From my assessment today there is no care. The safety of urgent care attenders is at risk. I call out to CQC to carry out a review of this centre urgently.

The doctors and nurses are amazing when you do get to see them I must say.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Went to a&e on 6/1021 with a bad gum infection, although there a long wait , which I knew before I arrived, I would just like to say a big thanks to all staff in a&e , and operating theatre, also all at lyner ward , thanks Ian

readBy.name: University Hospitals Plymouth NHS Trust

title: Positive Experiance
body:
Recently had to attend Opthalmagy, A & E & the Stroke Ward, all related to my medical condition & in each department found the staff to be very caring, patient & professional at all times.
Grateful thanks to everyone who took care of me.

title: Stay away
body: Since new management takes charge 2 years ago the Surgery  is going downhill.You can’t get appointments ,you cant see the Doctor you have to consult with the Doctor through an online form which is not convenient for elderly patients .When ever you want to complain to the practice manager she is in meeting or out of Surgery .I spoke with my councillor and MP and we are going to sign a petition to sort out this mess.

title: Fantastic
body: Lovely physiotherapist, very helpful and informative in explaining my situation and where we go go forward!

title: Quick and efficient care
body: I rang at 6pm as I had symptoms of a urine infection. Lovely lady on the phone and got medicine 15 mins later. Thank you

title: Flow test team in Beedon House
body: Since my holep opetation in July I have had cause to visit this department sevetal times. They are consumately professional and very reasuring when post op problems occured. Always approachable and cheerful. Will always try to fit in an appointment if you have any concerns. I eould recommend the team (because they really are) to anyone.

title: Horrendous
body: I went here as I thought I had fractured my ankle, I was in agony, could just about walk to get myself to the desk. Got into triage with the nurse she took one look at me and told me I was fine and to go home. Refused to x-ray it. I still have problems with this ankle now 7 months on. If she had taken the time to examine me properly I would of been sorted and I didn't even feel I could go back as I knew I wouldn't be listened too. I work for the NHS and would never treat someone like this. Disgusting service.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Perfect appointment
body:
I visited to see the nurse.I have not been to the surgery since the beginning of lockdown.I had no problem inside the surgery.The appointments were running smooth and the surgery was set out in a very Covid safe way.
There was a safe feeling as there were not many patients in the surgery at the same time.

title: put me a very anxious person at ease thankyou
body: after a skin check was found to have a melanoma scary time but i can't praise the staff enough for the care i have been given 2 excisions and hopefully now clear well done for providing such good care

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
After severing the fingers of my left hand on my table saw, I thought that I would have at least two amputated. I am extremely grateful to the surgical team who were able to reconstruct them. Whilst I do have some tendon and nerve damage at least I have all my fingers and able to use them.
While thanking the surgical team I also give thanks to all the theatre staff who assisted in any way together with the Sister and nurses on the ward, not forgetting the physiotherapists who have looked after my aftercare.
I understand I am unable to name individuals but would love to do so.

title: Absolutely disgusting practice
body: Have been trying to get a phone consultation from my GP any GP, and have been ignored for 2.5 years! Yes I say years. There is 1 Gp there, and the reception staff, try to act as GPS, I was on hold trying to get hold of them, as a emergency, finally gave up and walked over there, still on hold, to witness reception staff just sat there drinking tea, having a chat and ignoring patients calls.

title: Good service
body: The person who administered my flu jab was friendly and competent.Made me very relaxed prior to being injected this made me feel very calm and at ease instead of frightened

title: You'll be on hold for ever
body:
Quite possibly the worst reception staff I've ever experienced anywhere. Now given legitimacy to be even ruder by the pandemic. It's easier just to go private. Fordingbridge this is what you get, a service not fit for purpose.
Doctors are quite happy calling in social workers to meddle in your family affairs but they miss simple blood test results that prematurely end the lives of people we know and think an apology letter will cover the loss. Because of a lack of alternatives just like the awful Fordingbridge dentistry practice we are stuck with them.

title: Amazing service!
body:
I had my copper coil fitted at the clinic 10 years ago and due for replacement- an appointment was booked over the phone with a friendly staff. I followed by a phone consultation and appointment the next week.

I received a phenomenal service with incredibly competent Doctor and assistant.
I felt very well cared after during the procedure and supported throughout with a relaxing music curated to calm the patients and kind words. 
It barely hurt and I now have another 10 years of peace of mind with the copper coil!
Really recommend both tje clinic, the amazing staff and the coil as a contraceptive!

title: Fair practice
body: I recently had a flu jab and the practitioner was very nice and polite.I have found lately that it is just too difficult to talk with a doctor, although there are sometimes when things seem to go much better.

title: Excellent, caring practice
body: Recently needed to be seen quickly about a worrying issue. Reception staff were so kind and helpful and I saw my favourite GP straight away. Considering how frenetic life has been I was very impressed with the speed with which they sorted out both my tests and referrals. Thank you!

title: Flu Jab today Fantastic Service
body:
Had Flu Jab today.
Fantastic service well organised
could not have asked for more.
No queuing, plenty of staff to attend to numbers of people there for their Jan . Well done to Penketh health centre. There are issues getting through on the phone, not unusual to try & get through for 30mins. When you get through all appointment s are gone they say try again tomorrow. Very frustrating. Not sure if this is the same in all surgery's but it's been like this well before the Pandemic at this practice.

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Flu jab
body: Excellent service quick and simple 1024 appointment yet jabbed at 10:21 home with a coffee by 10:30. Highly recommend this service

title: Excellent service, very helpful.
body: I had the flu jab this morning, separate entrance and exit, pleasant staff throughout, have been very helpful generally in my experience over the last ten + years.

title: First Class
body: Everything very well organised, worked like clockwork.  Had our flu vaccinations last month and our boosters today.   All staff were top class.

title: Great practice
body: I want to commend the service received in booking & accessing our flu jabs. Staff were very friendly & efficient. Impressive organisation

title: Flu vaccination
body: Excellent - very efficient and well managed.  The booking process was also very easy and I am very impressed.

title: 'Painless' flu jab
body: Just wanted to thank the wonderful staff in attendance for the cheerful, efficient way they administered the jab today. I also got a Pneumonia jab. They made the whole experience as pleasant and painless as possible. Thanks again.

title: In and out
body: Very well looked after, by caring staff, couldn't fault them, although would prefer to be kept in the loop when planned surgery time is delayed.

title: Great security guys
body: My car had a flat battery in the car park and won’t start. I was worried and don’t know what to do with a newly-born baby in the car. When I spoke to the security guys in the hospital. Without any hesitation they helped me to jump star the car and we can go then go home without too much delay. Many thanks! And the nurse who gave my son vaccination was friendly and great services, strongly recommend!

readBy.name: Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust

title: flu jab
body: went to have my flu jab this morning. it was really efficient and friendly. plenty of space for distancing and i hardly felt the jab at all.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Croydon
Help and Care
St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Winter Flu jab
body: My husband and I attended for a Winter Flu jab.  We were given a time and arrived expecting a queue as we had seen at another surgery on our journey.  But this was very well organised.  We gave our names, were shown where to go and we were in and out in next to no time.

title: Follow up consultation with Gp
body: Access to Highland Surgery appointment was easy and no delay experienced for the appointment which was conducted in a professional and friendly manner with my GP.

title: I’m happy
body:
I went for my flu jab today. My appointment was on time and I was in and out within five minutes. 

It appeared well organised and the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Outstanding practice and staff
body:
Our family is relatively new to the surgery, only attending for approximately 3 years. However, we have been extremely impressed by the professionalism, efficiency, friendliness and caring attitude of everyone from the doctors to nurses and admin staff.
Today we attended for the flu jab and again we were most impressed with the COVID precautions taken and the enthusiasm and friendliness of everyone with whom we had contact during our short appointment. Nothing was too much trouble and we were enthusiastically thanked for coming too. 
Having worked within the health service in the past and with some understanding of the pressures encountered in providing health services, I can only say that it was a pleasure to attend the surgery and that, as a patient, I was left feeling extremely reassured and wanted. 
In a period when all services are stretched and the work in the surgery is considerable, this surgery manages to work smoothly, very efficiently and all of it is delivered with a smile.
Just a fantastic provision of services.

title: Flu vaccination service
body: Very pleased with all staff from clinicians to admin staff this morning at Sat flu clinic.  Very welcoming, efficient service. Opportunity to get blood form for cholesterol and review blood pressure. Thank you

title: Poor practice
body: No consideration for patient care. Impossible to get through on the telephone sometimes wait 20 minutes for an answer and then expected to wait for a telephone consultation call from doctor .  I waited all day   I have not seen doctor for two years face to face.  I should have blood pressure check And yearly blood test.

title: Great
body: Very professional and listened to me. Explained everything well and put me at my ease. She talked me through what was happening, and explained what would happen next clearly.

title: Well organised
body: Efficient flu jab clinic very well organised in and out quickly................. ........ ...... ...... ......

title: Could not have cared less
body:
My 83 year old father was admitted to 2c 5 weeks ago with a suspected heart attack and diagnosed Covid positive. Today he was sent to a care home, which we had not approved, without notice. One of my brothers was sent a text message at 3pm saying that he would be discharged at 3.20pm. He arrived at the care home at 3.15pm, five minutes before discharge - quite a feat. The care home (we found out where he was at 6.30pm) indicated that this is typical of Whiston Hospital. We have been unable to see my father for 5 weeks, the staff have refused to let us speak to him, telling that he was asleep no matter what the time of day. Now they discharge him without telling us as if he is a piece of rubbish to be got rid of. Pals have been contacted in 2 separate occasions and failed to contact us in return - complete and utter failure. 
Whiston Hospital is fine as long as you don’t challenge them in any way, once you do they are completely cruel towards the person in hospital. How they call themselves members of a caring profession is beyond me - they have been anything but caring in the way that they have treated a very vulnerable old man. Never let your elderly relative anywhere near the place is my advice.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Can’t fault this surgery
body: Been a patient here for years and I don’t have a bad word to say about it. They are proactive and I’ve never had a problem getting an appointment. Keep up the good work. I am very grateful.

title: Always helpful
body: Although difficult to get through to on the phone, probably to the massive demand I have always been treated respectfully and helpfully by reception team. I had a telephone consultation and was then asked to come in to be seen and am waiting for tests. Much appreciation to all NHS staff in these hard times

title: great hospital Stoke all involved staff
body: excellent service by all staff involved paramedics trauma team dr s surgeons staff nurses canteen staff n cleaners n mhw within the hospital  a excellent service u all provide many thanks to u all mentioned n my kind regards to u all a 5 star rating to every 1 mentioned  many many thanks to u all for all ur kindness care help n thought towards me 😁👍

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great people and good service
body: Came here for a eeg scan the staff were very friendly did very professional very quick kept me calm asked me lots of questions

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great docs, indifferent reception staff
body: Reception is at best unfriendly,  sometimes rude. No smile, no welcome. Can't be bothered. The doctors are excellent: professional,  efficient and knowledgeable.

title: Fantastic local hospital
body:
I was referred to Conquest Hospital by my local GP surgery. It took less than a week to get an appointment with the consultant which was amazing and help limit my worry. 
At the appointment the Consultant and the Attending Nurse were excellent and reassuring. 
Then my follow up appointment with the Ultrasound Team was also within two weeks, the Sonographer was excellent and very friendly. 
I'd also like to thank the nurse who did my follow up blood test, she was lovely. I was seen so quickly too. 

I have been so impressed by the quality of care, the facilities and the speed of appointments. Thank you.

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Wonderful support
body: I’ve experienced fabulous service and support from Breast Cancer Services since my diagnosis in mid September. From the friendly, gentle, radiographers (I think that’s the job title of the lovely ladies who’ve done my mammograms) to the doctors and nurses who’ve talked me through the situation and treatment options. I had my op yesterday (8/10/2021 I’ve left a separate review) and hopefully it’s onwards and upwards from now on. I can’t thank you all enough. 😍 Ps can’t exit without saying how grateful I am to the NHS in general and the life saving (probably literally in my case) screening programs we have in the UK. Forever grateful……

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Hysteroscopy… a positive experience
body:
After referral by my GP following slight post-menopausal bleeding, I was seen within 2 weeks at my nearest clinic at Dewsbury Hospital, where I had a trans- vaginal ultrasound and pelvic examination. Both were painless, staff were caring and responsive to my needs. I was advised an outpatients Hysteroscopy was recommended as I had a slightly thickened endometrial lining. Leaving with an explanatory leaflet, explaining a fairly simple, mostly painless procedure 
(albeit there was a warning that some women could find it extremely painful), I took to the internet for further investigation … and really wish I hadn’t! Whilst there were some encouraging reports, there were quite a large number of reviews across various social media/medical platforms stating that the procedure was brutal and worse than childbirth! And I believe for some it is.
Within the next 3 weeks, I had my appointment,this time at Pinderfields. I have to say that I was very nervous about the level of potential pain/discomfort I could bear as a post menopausal, 57 year old who has never given birth! I really shouldn’t have worried SO much. All the staff in outpatient department 8B were excellent. The lovely doctor performing the procedure told me what was going to happen and she listened to my concerns about not having a local anaesthetic. She advised that she would know straight away by how my cervix reacted, and if she thought there would be difficulties/it was too painful, she would administer a LA. In the treatment room also were two nurses.. one to stay and chat by my side and another to assist the doctor. They were all lovely, chatty and very reassuring. I can’t say that the procedure wasn’t uncomfortable at times, because it was. The initial use of the speculum was uncomfortable, but that’s probably my individual situation. I think the ungainly, awkward presence of the instruments and the anticipation of bad pain, which didn’t really materialise, was the worst part of the process.  I felt some light cramping period type pains pushing through my cervix and once the hysteroscope was in my uterus, and slight nipping pains when the small polyps that were discovered were removed. My procedure took about 25 minutes altogether and I was given a lovely relaxing cup of tea and biscuit afterwards.  
I thought it important to write this review to show that as individuals each of our experiences can be different. It was explained that the procedure can stop at any point if it became too painful.  Choice is the keyword. Don’t be pressured into anything you’re not happy with. 
Thanks again to the fabulous NHS staff who cared for me so well that morning.

readBy.name: Mid Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Helpful and Friendly surgery
body: I have been with this surgery for over 23 years, I’ve always had excellent care from everyone at this surgery.

title: Long long wait
body: 12 hour wait and counting with no visibility as to when any of us will be seen. Appreciate that they must be hugely understaffed but it’s a long time to wait.  Some people have been here for 17 hours

title: So much improvement required
body: Visiting my partner in CCU, the basics; the signage to all departments needs reviewing, where does it state CCU is on the second floor?! Telephone contact; a painful experience all "voice activated" and completely useless. The telephone line into the hospital is defective it's very hard to hear what the operator is saying. My partner's experience; no running hot water, a defective toilet for use by 12 patients) no working shower (despite staff being aware it was defective). One nurse on duty for 12 patients. Car parking signage missing, no signs to show you the way out! (You follow the way to the disabled parking bays by the way!). The general maintenance is very poor, access for visitors and ease of use appalling. A basic walk around the building with a note pad and pen noting the very obvious deficiencies could be carried out in an afternoon. The telephone system perhaps could be put in a museum of 1980's technology it has no place in 2021.

title: A revelation in care
body: I cannot speak highly enough of this practice. Every single encounter I have had here over the last 3 years has been a positive experience with all staff I have encountered going above and beyond any expectation I may have of a G.P. service. Simply remarkable in every respect. Thank you all so much.

title: Excellent care on Northbrook ward
body: Extremely caring nursing staff and brilliant consultant , we were so well looked after and heard another family near us on the ward say this too .

readBy.name: Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice, efficient and effective
body: Easy to book an appointment, everything worked smoothly and staff are excellent. Great communications. I have been at this surgery for 25 years and they consistently perform to a high standard.

title: Amazing Service
body: I was completely nervous about my up and coming cataract surgery, but I really didn't need to be. The complete SpaMedica team made me fee so at ease, from the person who greeted me at the door on arrival to the receptionists when leaving, everything was great. They explained everything, made sure I was happy and comfortable and listened to all of my concerns. The surgery was painless, quick and amazing. The after care explanation was great. I cannot recommend them enough. Thank you to everyone

title: Horrendous maintenance and upkeep - needs an in…
body:
Where do I start?
I have visited a number of local care homes in September and October 2021 and researched them in depth to look for a potential new home for a relative of mine.

This by far is the WORST care home I have EVER come across even just from the outside.

I am totally stunned as to how anyone could let a building get into such a state as this.

I had a little nosey before thinking about going in or contacting them as a potential new home for a relative of mine.

There is waste and loose bricks on the front driveway which a kid could get trapped under if they fell on them.

There are trip hazards on the wheelchair ramp leading up to the entrance where the astroturf isn't fixed and there are. Door mats outside the ramp leading up to the main door threshold. 

They have "sealed" a window with standard household expanding foam.
There are defective bricks on the front/ side visible by the public and defective render/apalling repairs etc
Improvements needed have been mentioned on 2012 cqc reports and every other report produced since 2009 to be factual.

The same reasons given every time are along the same lines of being in the process of carrying out improvements or repairs.

This so far, from the exterior do not appear to meet building Regs or the VFM standards etc.

There is even vegetation growing out the cracked and defective brickwork at the front.

Goodness knows whether there is damp inside affecting health and wellbeing of anyone setting foot in the actual building.

There looks to be a high staff turnover and poor reviews on employment websites regarding how the managers operate. I cannot comment on this as I can only go off the trends in all these reviews left by former employees etc but it is relevant in that it confirms the points in all the CQC inspection reports regarding the lack of management for documentation to manage and prevent risks. 

Looking at how quickly the clatterbridge Liverpool hospital was built from scratch, how has this care home got away with shoddy repairs clearly not undertaken by professionals (under the Hackett review this is not good practice) and how have they not completed the improvements they were told to make year in year out on the back of the CQC reports since 2009?
This is very concerning to think they actually provide care services for human beings but appear to have a total disregard to safety and protection from risks of their service users,  staff, visitors by not taking these risks seriously.

I hope no one else gets hurt here which is why I felt the need to say something as I couldn't live with myself not doing so, based on all the research I have done on this care home. It really has got to me and I'm so glad I found this place as I definitely won't be sending my relative here.

readBy.name: Imperial College London, Faculty of Medicine

title: Don't provide treatment
body: I have been calling all year about joint and muscle pain I have had one knee scan and provided pain relief and told I'm fine. Yet I am still in pain and have restricted movement.

title: Fast and Efficient
body: The whole service was very impressive! It was quick and efficient with staff being friendly and courteous.

title: Outstanding care
body:
What a team of professionals!  What can I say to thank you all.  Your care, professionalism, dedication, patience and understanding are immeasurable. 

From the minute I arrived in the Sanderson Suite I was overwhelmed by the welcome and reassurance that was immediately given.  The team perform like a well oiled machine, each playing a vital and important role. 

My experience was certainly a very positive one. I was treated with kindness, compassion, dignity and complete respect.  The whole team were reassuring, polite and in addition to your undoubted care, you all made me smile. 

I attended the Sanderson Suite as a day patient for breast surgery and would like to show my gratitude for such outstanding care.   To the surgical team, my wonderful surgeon and breast care nurse, for whom “thank you” will never be enough, the lovely anaesthetists and all the nursing staff who provided endless reassurance, made me smile and provided the best toast ever!  Thank you to the cleaning staff for ensuring everyone’s safety by providing a spotless ward and not forgetting the receptionists who provided my worrying husband with coffee and biscuits!  A sincere and heartfelt thank you, you are all appreciated more than you could ever realise. x

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: great practics
body: needed to speak to a doctor contacted the surgery at 8:45 by 1 pm the doctor contacted me very helpful with good advice didn't rush call very pleased with this surgery my partner will be changing.

title: Great surgery
body: We have just been for our flu jabs,on a Sunday morning.The service was great,name checked off then straight to room 7,had our jabs then straight out.This surgery must be one of the best in the Nottinghamshire.

title: Spot on
body: Came for my flu jab, very well organised and friendly. Was done super quick and with a smile to ease any worry away.

title: An Exceptional Service
body: I haven’t used A&E before and was struck by how efficient the staff were, how quick I was treated and how kind and respectful the doctors, nurses and admin support were. I didn’t know what to expect when I arrived but left having had a very positive experience. Thank you.

title: Caring and friendly
body: My aunt spent the final 7 years of her life at Enbridge House, initially paying privately but, when eventually her funds ran out, graduating to county council support. Her experiences with "home care", and a trial period in a more modern (no doubt efficient) care home in the area, had been depressing as the personnel in both situations had not made meaningful personal contact with her, to the point of apparent rudeness. It was therefore a relief to find that after a few weeks' settling in at Enbridge House, my aunt had formed an excellent relationship with the owner and staff, and frequently told us that she was happy to be there. In her late 90s and when she passed her 100th birthday, she became increasingly unable to hear conversations or to concentrate on them, so the family atmosphere of the home, the cheerfully attentive attitude of the carers, and their knack of bypassing hurdles to communication with their clients, made her day-to-day existence bearable despite her various long-term health issues. I am aware of the CQC report in August 2021 which found various aspects of the home inadequate: all I can is that the report writer did not experience the high quality of care which I, my sister, and my aunt's other visitors frequently remarked upon. Enbridge House has a good reputation in nearby Newbury, and I wonder how many (if any) residents, or relatives of residents, were asked for their views and experiences before that report was finalised. The only criticism I would make of the home is that it could do with some refurbishment particularly to the frontage and exterior, which would probably be the first thing to happen should a marketing guru be appointed. But what really matters in a care home, which I shall remember when it's my turn to go into one, is friendliness of the staff towards residents and the homely atmosphere which that leads to. Enbridge House was first-rate in that regard.

title: Great organisation
body: Had my flu jab, really well organised, easy to book and in and out in under 10 minutes. Friendly staff. Well done to the practice x

title: Excellent all round care
body:
Underwent total knee replacement surgery on the 20 September. The surgery went well and the after care was faultless.
I was looked after very well from pre op' to discharge.

title: Working well in extraordinary times.
body:
Emailed in problem. Quick response seeking clarification.  Medication issued for short time.  Sorted. 
Thank you.

title: Too busy to check blood pressure
body: I have to help one of my neighbours who has high blood pressure a blood pressure test using a home machine because the nurse at Bath Row surgery claimed she was too busy to take his blood pressure even though ordered to by the doctor. He was also earlier told by the receptionist that you did not need appointments for blood pressure  checks as doctors could take them over the phone.

title: Great practice
body: I've been patient of the practice my whole life, and the service the GPs and staff provide here is invaluable. They have helped me through my darkest hour and I am forever grateful for it. The NHS is a 'cornerstone' of British society and it must remain publically owned if we are to all benefit from it the same.

title: Excellent surgery
body: This surgery is coping very well considering the huge impact the Covid 19 pandemic has had on the NHS. Well done to all concerned.

title: one of the worse practice I have seen in my 43…
body: I have been turned away with my 2 and a half years old son as I was 30min late because I had to wait 24h for results for COV19. I wouldn't except that they turn me away on the phone I went there with him and the practise was completely empty! Also they have lost my vaccinations papers that I had to physically bring and give it to them. The reception is on the street and you have to wait outside and all the information you received are through the window. I am changing the doctors even if I will have to drive 25km from now on to see a doctor.

title: Amazing customer service
body: I just wanted to say a huge thank you for the staff that dealt with me and my daughter last night. We were quickly shown through to the paediatric emergency ward and everyone we met was nothing but friendly. The customer service, at a time I was at my most stressed, was absolutely incredible. Everyone was friendly, reassuring and lovely. Even though my daughter was asleep, the staff managed to complete all her checks and were really helpful in carrying things and helping me. A big shout out to the X-ray staff as well, who were friendly and attentive to my daughters needs as well, despite her being wriggly! The doctors and staff were brilliant and I am really thankful for their attitude, friendliness and level of care. Thanks so much. It was really appreciated.

title: Great Practice
body: A Very Skilled and Reassuring Vaccination Project In 2021, in two main sessions held at Cheltenham Fire Station. The advanced invitation administration was really helpful and effective. The staff and site administration/organisation was world class.

title: Flu Jab Process
body: Timings were accurate as parking locally difficult. Great signage for direction. Brilliant staff on door, inside the hall and the 'Injector'. My mother in law (aged 94) and myself were warmly welcomed with no fuss. Her appointment was later but she was sorted as fast as I was and so she was happy (remarkable indeed ha ha).

title: Well Organised
body: Arrived for a flu jab. System in place was quick and efficient and made you feel safe with the one way system.

title: Tablets
body: This surgery is a joke they have left my brother without medication for 5 days now saying he has enough when he has run out, he has high blood pressure, cholesterol, suffers with mental health which he is on anti depressant for yet they won't sort his meds, complaint is being made against these incompetent fools

title: Bad service
body:
Rang for a very painful and blocked ear that I suspected to be an ear infection, doctor called back a couple of hours later. I told him my symptoms and instead of asking to see me so he could actually have a look he just told me to go get some drops from Chemist and buy some pain killers. Two days after this I had to go to Pontefract hospital at midnight as the pain had got so bad, a doctor took one look and said that’s it’s a particular bad infection! I have been given antibiotic spray and antibiotic tablets for my ear. Why am I having to go to a hospital taking up doctors time for something that my GP should he caught and treated!!! Why are you still refusing to see patience but you expect hospitals still should! The hospitals are doing your job for you while you hide behind the covid excuse and people are suffering for it, I put up with this for two weeks before finally getting treatment! 

Not impressed, poor service, thank god hospitals are still doing their job

title: Friendly, professional and very patient aware
body: I joined the Surgery earlier on this year after relocating from The Black Country. Thus far, I have found all Staff members to be friendly, professional and attentive. The Doctors and Nurses that I have seen have all been incredibly helpful and have definitely helped to change my life for the better, both physically and mentally. If I were to score the practice out of 100, I would score them 100! Fantastic experience to date and I am sure that this will continue to be the case.

title: A confusing experience
body: I was in Connolly ward for around 8 months and i found it to be scary and was constantly worried about being attacked by others. I was attacked a few times and was forced to defend myself. The staff mostly lovely people but it took me months to realise which ones were genuinely caring and not just there for a pay check. The foods pretty great in my opinion. Some of the staff are amazing people who deserve an award or some recognition for the care they provide. Biggest downside to the place is the bed spaces, Nothing made me more anxious than a new guy in the bays I stayed in, 4 to 5 random people in a room isn’t a good experience, sometimes it’s alright when you all get along but it only takes one person to ruin that. Constant noise all throughout the day is prevalent and at times made me literally want to stab ears with pens and whatknot just to get some peace witch can only be found if your aloud leave. The place is great sometimes unless there’s some bad apples about. In the end the majority of staff are lovely with a few exceptions. I’d love to get involved in fundraising for the phc but don’t know we’re to start. Thanks

title: Average practice
body: I was recently called for a flu jab and was attended to within 15 minutes but I have been to this practice before and waited over 20 minutes to been seen.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Very professional service, has a very good process in place, in terms of the situation we are all in with the pandemic. Keeping to the social distancing rules and regulations once you have entered the building. Waiting time is very well addressed, I didn’t wait long before I was called in to see the doctor. I would like to thank the doctor for the diagnosis and the recommended treatment, although I have a long way to go but it’s a start in the right direction. Thank you.

title: Flu Vaccination
body: A very well organised, efficient session.  Lovely friendly staff.  Thank you to the lady in the car park too, who stood in the rain directing the cars to parking spaces!

title: Great GP
body: I hat a telephone appointment , GP was absolutely great. Very polite, understanding and advice given

title: Great practice
body: The receptionists are friendly and approachable. The nurses are knowledgeable and give professional care and advice. Friends and family at other practices are envious of the service we get at Brownhill Surgery.

title: Great practice and new practice nurse
body: I’ve been a patient at Lepton Surgery for over 35 years and have always had good service. I had my flu jab yesterday and from walking in until leaving, it took less than 5 minutes. The new practice nurse is lovely, she was well prepared, confident and reassuring. I didn’t feel a thing having my jab and my arm isn’t sore at all. Thank you!

title: Flu vaccination
body: I attended this morning for a flu vaccination. Lots of staff in on a Saturday to help. Very efficient clinic. Thank you!

title: Continued good level of service in most areas
body:
I have visited HHC too many times to count this year. When needing an emergency surgical referral I was seen the same day and have spoken to a doctor within three days every time I have needed to. The practice nurses have been accomodating when I required daily nurse appointments and reception have made every effort to provide accurate advice, although it's necessary to question it if you are unsure. 

It's very unhelpful that the website messaging system is not in use and on average it takes about 8 calls to get in the queue, and then a twenty minute wait to speak to someone. An extra administrator to deal with online queries would be marvelous!

title: Quick flu jab
body: Two reception windows open, one for flu. Overall time from arrival to injection about 10min. Friendly staff , no problems.
